text: Parmotrema adspersum is a species of lichen in the family Parmeliaceae. It was originally described as a species of Parmelia by Edvard August Vainio in 1907. John Elix transferred it to Parmotrema in 2002, reasoning that its thick- walled ascospores (measuring 16–18 by 6–8 μm) are typical of that genus. Parmotrema adspersum is common in Thailand and the Philippines. ==See also== *List of Parmotrema species ==References== Category:Fungi described in 1907 Category:Fungi of Asia adspersum
title: Parmotrema adspersum
